meanings.sent1: Her deprecatory remarks about the movie were not well-received.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's deprecatory tone made the students feel discouraged.
meanings.sent3: He couldn't help but chuckle at her deprecatory comments about his cooking skills.
meanings.sent4: The deprecatory glances from the judges made her nervous during the competition.
meanings.sent5: The deprecatory feedback from the boss lingered in his mind long after the meeting.

meanings.sent1: His deprecatory attitude towards others often caused conflicts.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't stand his deprecatory remarks about her work.
meanings.sent3: Despite his deprecatory comments, she remained confident in her abilities.
meanings.sent4: The deprecatory jokes at the party made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent5: The deprecatory behavior of the bully was not tolerated in the school.

meanings.sent1: The deprecatory looks from her parents made her rethink her choices.
meanings.sent2: His deprecatory gestures towards the proposal were evident to everyone.
meanings.sent3: Even his deprecatory sighs couldn't deter her from pursuing her dreams.
meanings.sent4: The deprecatory tone in her voice revealed her true feelings about the situation.
meanings.sent5: The deprecatory expressions on their faces indicated their dissatisfaction with the decision.
